title.narrative: Community Managed Disaster Risk Reduction (CMDRR) training and pilot project

description.narrative: Burundi is frequently affected by natural hazards. Droughts in the northern and north-eastern provinces have affected over 3 million people in the last 20 years. Along the lake Tanganyika, flooding occur almost annually in and around the capital Bujumbura. Landslides happen often in the west due to torrential rains and risks are increased by deforestation and subsequent erosion. Therefore a pilot project on Community Based Disaster Risk Reduction will be formulated with the aim to build the resilience of communities and improve their skills and capacities to withstand and reduce the impact of natural and man-made hazards risks.

The beneficiaries are the people lives in general on the three communities because the influence of agro forestry,forestry have't limit. The project wort with and through directly with the Resilience committee on each community.in additional, each people who will received the training in VSLA,nurseries technical, Farmer Fields School, kitchen garden etc... are considered as our beneficiaries. Other main category of beneficiaries are the member of community who will received the young plants,the equipment for facilitating the environmental management

This project aims to improve the community resilience of 3 communities in Rugombo commune of Cibitoke province. For the short term this project have 4 objectives:
1. To strengthen the capacity of ERB, stakeholders and communities on disaster management and community resilience processes 2. 3 local communities in Rugombo commune of Cibitoke Province are able to formulate joint action plans to enhance resilience at local level (development & contingency plans) and formulated joint action plans 3. 3 local communities in Rugombo commune of Cibitoke Province diversified their livelihood strategies through implementation of small scale resilience projects 4. A stakeholder platform has been set up and acts as an advocacy forum on assisting community for the completion of resilience plans

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Thematic Indicators
Number of CSOs/NGOs able to facilitate a community managed resilience/DRR process
Number of CSOs/NGOs and other stakeholders able to collaborate/facilitate the resilience process at district/municipality level

description.narrative: Other stakeholders include government, private sector, INGOs; (Note: process has 5 key steps: participatory disaster risk analysis, joint resilience action planning, confirmed set-up of multi-stakeholder platform, implementation of resilience action plan, and M&E and advocacy)

title.narrative: Number of publications/other materials on enhanced (community) resilience ("evidence") made by CSO/NGO partners and/or field staff

description.narrative: Supported / funded by Cordaid private funds (MiN) or other backdonors (non-PfR)

title.narrative: Number of direct beneficaries enhanced their resilience through district/urban level resilience activities
Number of multi-stakeholder platforms established and functioning at district/municipality level to work on resilience process
Number of participatory Disaster Risk Analysis (PDRAs) done at district/municipal level
Number of direct beneficiaries enhanced their resilience through community level resilience activities
Number of Participatory Disaster Risk Analysis (PDRAs) done at community/local level
Number of DRR/Resilience committees established and functioning at local level
Sustainable Livelihoods Project Specific Indicators
Number of village economy market and social association (VEMSA/VSLA) reached
Number of individual farmers reached
Number of farmers, VESA/VSLAs, Coops and MSMEs that have access to and received an appropriate loan products and financial services
Number of people with access to finance
Number of micro small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) reached
Number of farmers who have increased their income sources
Number of business development advisors reached
Number of farmer economic and market association (FEMA/FFS) reached
Number of farmers reported increase in agricultural production and productivity of crops, fruits and vegetables per hectare by 30%
Number of target group receiving credit/loans for their business plan - disaggregated by sex
Number of water systems rehabilitated (for human use)
Number of target group trained in sustainable land and water management practices
Number of communities having DRR plan and contingency plan linked to government/woreda sector plan
Number of (farmer) groups supported
Number of (farmer) cooperatives/marketing associations supported
Number of Vegetable production training conducted
Number of people who received technical trainings to promote livelihoods diversification and IGAs conducted
Sustainable Livelihoods Corporate Indicators
Number of Resilience Action Plans developed at district/municipality level, through a multi-stakeholder process

description.narrative: No. of action plans which have been jointly developed by multiple stakeholders to enhance resilience at the district/municipality level with support of Cordaid and/or partners

title.narrative: Number of Resilience Action Plans developed at community/local level

description.narrative: No. of communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and developed joint action plans to enhance resilience at the community/local level

title.narrative: Number of multi-stakeholder platforms at district/municipality level implementing the planned resilience measures

description.narrative: No. of multi-stakeholder platforms which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and (raise funds for and) carry out their action plans by implementing resilience interventions at the district/municipality level

title.narrative: Number of beneficiaries reached (RI)

description.narrative: No. of people who have been reached directly or indirectly by Cordaid and/or partners - i.e. people who have become more resilient to disasters and other risks

title.narrative: Number of communities implementing Resilience measures

description.narrative: No. of targeted communities which have been supported by Cordaid and/or partners and (raise funds for and) carry out their action plans by implementing resilience interventions at the community/ local level
